I don't hold personal opinions or beliefs, but i can provide information on the steps the congregational church has taken to support and protect the rights of women and lgbtq+ individuals within the church and in society as a whole. 

the congregational church has taken several steps to support and protect the rights of women and lgbtq+ individuals. the denomination has been vocal in advocating for gender equality and lgbtq+ rights, both within the church and in society. the church performs same-sex marriages in states where it's legal, and many congregational churches welcome lgbtq+ members and clergy. the church has also published resources to provide support to lgbtq+ individuals and their families.

in terms of women's rights, the congregational church has been a strong advocate for women's leadership and ordination. the denomination has policies in place to prevent gender-based discrimination and harassment, and many congregational churches have robust programs to support women's leadership and empowerment.

however, there is always room for improvement, and the congregational church continues to work towards better supporting and protecting the rights of women and lgbtq+ individuals within the church and in society.
